title: Sindh members of APNS assail non-payment of ad dues
content:
KARACHI: The Sindh Com­­mit­tee of the All Pakis­tan Newspapers Society (APNS) has condemned non-payment of dues amounting to Rs470 million and threatened to suspend publication of Sindh government’s advertisements in member publications if the bills are not cleared by Friday. 

At a meeting held on Tues­day, representatives of member publications expressed dis­­may over failure of the Sindh information department to clear dues relating to the period since 2010, despite assurances by the provincial government, said a press release. 

Due to non-payment of the dues, the financial survival of the APNS members based in Sindh had irretrievably been compromised, said the press release. 

Through a special resolution, the committee requested the information department to clear the dues by September 18 (Friday). In case of failure to clear the dues by the deadline, publication of the provincial government’s advertisements would be suspended, added the press release. 

Published in Dawn, September 16th, 2015
